channel.title: Makefile on Tosone's Blog
channel.description: Recent content in Makefile on Tosone's Blog

item.title: PHONY target
item.description: A phony target is one that is not really the name of a file; rather it is just a name for a recipe to be executed when you make an explicit request. There are two reasons to use a phony target: to avoid a conflict with a file of the same name, and to improve performance.
